Package tuition

Class TuitionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • tuition.TuitionManager
  • public class TuitionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class we use to implement all of other class this class does many functions such as add, enroll, remove, and load a file from text
    Author:
    Sharukh Khan, Hamad Naveed

      private void loadRoster()
      This method loads student objects into the roster from a txt file It will read the first token and determine which subclass to use for the constructor for example if the first token is R then it will use the Resident method to create a resident object

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Reads through user input and performs valid commands until terminated. If command is valid StringTokenizer separates the user input line into tokens for readability. The appropriate method is called to perform the command. While loop terminated by Q command.

      • loadRoster

        private void loadRoster()
        This method loads student objects into the roster from a txt file It will read the first token and determine which subclass to use for the constructor for example if the first token is R then it will use the Resident method to create a resident object

      • buildResidentStudent

        private Student buildResidentStudent​(java.util.StringTokenizer input)
        This method will build the Resident constructor It will ask for user input and store the inputs into a profile constructor as well as ask for additional information This will also handle errors such as negative credits or check whether the integer is an integer
        Parameters:
        input - to process the tokens and store them into profile constructor

      • removeStudentFromRoster

        private void removeStudentFromRoster​(Roster roster,
                                     java.util.StringTokenizer input)
        Removes student from the Roster class array. If student exist in the array it is deleted and the appropriate statement is printed. If student is not in the array the appropriate statement is printed.
        Parameters:
        roster - object that correlates to the array
        input - user student input

      • changeMajor

        private void changeMajor​(Roster roster,
                         java.util.StringTokenizer input)
        Removes student from the Roster class array. If student exist in the array it's major is changed If student is not in the array the appropriate statement is printed. If student is not in the array the appropriate statement is printed.
        Parameters:
        roster - object that correlates to the array
        input - user student input

      • checkTriStateValidity

        private boolean checkTriStateValidity​(java.lang.String state)
        Validates if student is a TriState students based on residence in NY or CT.
        Parameters:
        state - provided by the user
        Returns:
        true if states are NY or CT, false if not.

      • checkInternationalValidity

        private boolean checkInternationalValidity​(int credits,
                                           boolean studyingAbroad)
        Methods checks if International student is part of the study abroad program.
        Parameters:
        credits - given by user input of student information
        studyingAbroad - given by user input of student information
        Returns:
        true if student is an international student part of the study abroad program, otherwise returns false.
